result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert T Grubiak Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert T Grubiak Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert T Grubiak Jr was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
*   Pay $140 in Lab Costs.
*   Pay IID surcharge.
  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License.

records.addlTxt: Revoked WSP on 10/4/17

Amendment to Judgment of Conviction and Order-ERP, DOC-2259.  Def. has successfully completed the Earned Release Program.  It is ordered that DOC effectuate the change from confinement to extended supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in confinement and changing the remaining confinement to extended supervision.  The number of days converted from confinement time to extended supervision will be determined by DOC and be based upon actual release date.

presentence incarceration credit.
Extended Supervision Conditions-ordered by the court

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court imposes a total sentence of 4 1/2 years WSP consecutive to Racine 12CF177; 18 months initial confinement; 3 years extended supervision w/conditions; deft is eligible for CIP/SAP; no fine ordered at this time; costs ordered, IID surcharge ordered; $140 lab costs ordered; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge; 2 year suspension of DL; IID; OWI assessment.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Set for sentencing.  All parties just received PSI today, therefore the SEH is rescheduled to 4/23/15 at 10am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 2 & 3 are dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  SEH 4/20/15 at 1:30pm.  Bond continued.
With Atty Lassiter and ADA Delgado the FPT of 1/6/15 at 8:30am is rescheduled, as the deft has a revocation pending on 1/28/15; reset to 2/20/15 at 8:30am.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  For reasons set forth on the record, FPT continued to 1/6/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

138 p.m.  ADA Jessica Krejcarek  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clk  KZ.  Deft waives preliminary hearing.  Probable cause found.  Bound over to Br 3.  Substitution of Br. 3 filed; tab pulled for Br. 6.  Information filed.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  DAPT on 10/1/14 @ 130 p.m. & FPT on 11/5/14 @ 815 a.m.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Def. appeared in custody.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Case set for preliminary hearing this morning but Atty Carmen Lassiter is in other courts.  Status. conf. today at 1:00 to reset date for preliminary hearing.  Bond continued.
Carmen Lassiter

211pm
  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney C Lassiter.  Clerk LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days (deft waives time limits); set before Comm Mason on 9/30/14 @ 10am.  $7500  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).

*Not to Possess or Consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  *Not to drive w/o VALID Driver's License or without an ignition interlock installed.   If released, Report to WCS by 11:00 the next business day; Submit to random UA's upon request.  Comply w/ all program requirements & provide all required information.
